strings: <se_low>Yangus: You tend to get some weird characters lurkin' in old buildin's like this, eh?
<se_low>Yangus: Depends on the place as to whether they're 'uman or monster, mind.
<se_low>Yangus: I reckon this must be the tower we read about in that letter Munchie found.
<se_low>Yangus: There don't seem to be anyone about. Let's 'ope we can get inside...
<se_high>Bangerz: You'll need me to open the door to the tower, so I'll stay with you until we get there.
<se_low>Yangus: I wonder if that kid's got a key or somefin' to open the tower door for us?

<se_low>Yangus: I reckon it'll be knackerin' to climb all the way up there.
You'd be much better at it than me, guv.
<se_low>Yangus: That Jessica bird 'ad better not cause us no problems when we get all the way up to the top.

<se_low>Yangus: Looks like this must be the top.
Feels a bit diff'rent to the other floors.
<se_low>Yangus: No sign o' that Jessica girl Bangerz was on about though, eh?
<se_low>Yangus: I'm no good when it comes to sob stories like that.
<se_low>Yangus: I'll need a good ol' bawl to get it out of me system when I get a bit o' time on me own later.

<se_low>Yangus: Anyway, we'd better leave that Jessica be for a bit like she asked.
Let's go back to the village, eh?

<se_low>Yangus: Oh yeah!
We was about to climb the tower, right?
<se_low>Yangus: ...Hm, or was we? I can't remember.
<se_low>Yangus: We've already done wot we 'ad to do 'ere, ain't we?
<se_low>Yangus: Let's go somewhere else, guv.
<se_high>Jessica: Can we please wait a little while longer before we go back in the tower?
<se_low>Yangus: This is that place where the walls spin 'round, eh?

<se_low>Yangus: It was well confusin'!
I 'ad no idea where I was goin' most o' the time!
<se_def>Angelo: This tower looks a bit out of fashion.
<se_high>Jessica: Um, don't you think we should make the ship our first priority? We need to go to Trodain Castle and find out more about it.
<se_high>Jessica: I guess it's okay to take a detour, but we shouldn't waste too much time.
<se_low>Yangus: It was that Dhoulmagus who covered the castle wiv thorns then, eh? There's prob'ly monsters inside.
<se_low>Yangus: Maybe we should go an' do a bit of confessin' in church first, guv. Make sure this Goddess is on our side an' all that. Better safe than sorry!
<se_def>Angelo: You know, we've still got unfinished business at Trodain Castle.
<se_def>Angelo: I thought old freaky-features said we should look for something in the library. It's disrespectful not to listen to what he says, you know.
<se_high>Jessica: I've lived in Alexandria my whole life, and I never heard of any Moonshadow harp.

<se_high>Jessica: Take it from a local like me.
It isn't around here!

<se_low>Yangus: I don't think the Moonshadow 'arp's 'round 'ere.
Trust me. I'm an ex-thief.

<se_low>Yangus: But if you say we gotta look for it 'ere, guv, I'll do me bit.
You can count on good ol' Yangus.
<se_def>Angelo: It's not going to be caught in some fisherman's net or buried in a farmer's field, is it!?
<se_def>Angelo: There are more likely places we could be looking than this village of bumpkins! Let's not waste time!
<se_high>Jessica: Aren't we supposed to go through the tunnel in Ascantha Castle and find the thieves who stole the Moonshadow harp?
<se_high>Jessica: We'd better hurry up and give chase before it's too late! Come on!

<se_high>Jessica: They're pretty strong for a bunch of moles!
This is crazy!
<se_high>Jessica: We can't let them beat us. Let's go back and show them what we're really made of!
<se_low>Yangus: There's this place north of Ascantha surrounded by mountains. The only way to get there's by diggin' an 'ole.
<se_low>Yangus: Not a bad place for a thief's 'ideout, I reckon. Maybe that's where the geezer who stole the Moonshadow 'arp is.
<se_low>Yangus: Let's get a move on back to Ascantha Castle!
<se_low>Yangus: We ain't lettin' them moles keep the Moonshadow 'arp!
<se_low>Yangus: Moles... I dunno!
<se_low>Yangus: Just thinkin' about that awful racket the fat one made is enough to bring me dinner back up! Uuurgh!
<se_def>Angelo: I know the King said he'd summon his men and all that...

<se_def>Angelo: But it's King Pavan, right?
Hardly the most dynamic person we've ever met.
We'd better take care of this ourselves.

<se_def>Angelo: These moles won't get the better of us.
Right?
<se_def>Angelo: We'd better make sure we show them who's boss this time, or we'll never live it down!
<se_high>Jessica: We've got the harp! Now all we have to do is take it back to Ishmahri and he can use it to get the ship moving again.
<se_high>Jessica: Come on, let's hurry back to Trodain Castle! We've got to get back into that weird moon world!

<se_low>Yangus: I've been thinkin'.
We ain't never really been on a long boat journey together before, eh, guv?
<se_low>Yangus: Shame we can't rustle up a few deckchairs an' enjoy it a bit more, but I s'pose chasin' Dhoulmagus comes first.

<se_low>Yangus: Come on then, guv.
Let's go an' give the 'arp back to that Itchy-Marie bloke.

<se_def>Angelo: What was it that he said, that Ishmahri character?
Something about awakening the sea's memories?
<se_def>Angelo: It's rather a strange concept to get your head round... Still, no need for us to bother with the details.
<se_def>Angelo: Let's just head back to Trodain Castle and go through the Moonshadow window in the library.
<se_low>Yangus: Wot on earth are we doin' back 'ere...?

<se_low>Yangus: ...Er...not that I'm doubtin' ya, guv!
I'm sure you know best!

<se_def>Angelo: Some people seem to have a compulsion to climb tall buildings, for some reason.
I'm certainly not one of them.

<se_low>Yangus: Alexandra's...statue...
Hey, 'ang on a minute!
<se_low>Yangus: Guv! I've got it!

<se_low>Yangus: Wot 'ave I got!?
Hmm...I ain't sure yet, but it's gonna be good!

<se_low>Yangus: Sorry, I was gettin' carried away.
It's the jewels we should be thinkin' about.

<se_low>Yangus: Didn't ya see 'em?
There was some jewels that fell out o' the statue's eyes onto the floor!

<se_def>Angelo: You've climbed up here before, right?
So let's just get on up there sharpish.

<se_def>Angelo: Wow! I'm a bit dizzy!
I didn't realise Alexandra was such a looker.
<se_def>Angelo: If only I'd known in advance, I'd have brought her a single red rose or something. Oh well.
<se_low>Yangus: Now we can get them ‘Corn Spaniels’ over to Dominico like 'e asked, eh?
<se_low>Yangus: It's a shame we 'ave to take orders from a bossy ol' geezer like 'im, but needs must, I s'pose.
<se_def>Angelo: So we've got what we came for.
<se_def>Angelo: We'd better hurry back, otherwise the fearsome Jessica might bump off that old fatso!
<se_low>Yangus: I've got up to all kinds o' dodgy tricks in the past.

<se_low>Yangus: But I ain't never mistreated someone who's been good to me.
That's just bang out of order.

<se_low>Yangus: Bleedin'<endash>!
Whenever I think about it, me fists get itchy.
I wanna smack 'im one!
<se_def>Angelo: To be honest, if Jessica wasn't involved, I'd have no inclination to do anything for that despicable old despot.
<se_def>Angelo: But under the circumstances, we haven't got a lot of choice.
<se_low>Yangus: Wot we doin' 'ere again!?

<se_low>Yangus: It gets a bit exhaustin' always comin' back to the same place.
For me, anyway.
<se_def>Angelo: All these detours around here are a bit disrespectful to the beautiful Alexandra, in my opinion.
<se_high>Jessica: Whenever we come here, I can't help remembering...

<se_high>Jessica: So much has happened here. Losing Alistair<...>and meeting you, <hero>...
It's hard to know how to feel about the place.
<se_low>Yangus: Wot we doin' 'ere again!?

<se_low>Yangus: It gets a bit exhaustin' always comin' back to the same place.
For me, anyway.
<se_def>Angelo: All these detours around here are a bit disrespectful to the beautiful Alexandra, in my opinion.

<se_high>Jessica: What on earth are you thinking?
This is no time to be making a pilgrimage to the Alexandra statue!

<se_high>Jessica: We've made it this far thanks to our own hard work!
We don't need to pray for help!
<se_low>Yangus: I reckon it's a pretty good idea, comin' to a tall buildin' like this, cos we can search the sky more easy from up 'igh, can't we?

<se_def>Angelo: Don't forget that we can fly. We don't need to take a roundabout path like this.
We can just head straight for Rhapthorne's castle.

<se_high>Jessica: What on earth are you thinking?
This is no time to be making a pilgrimage to the Alexandra statue!

<se_high>Jessica: We've made it this far thanks to our own hard work!
We don't need to pray for help!
<se_low>Yangus: Wot if we defeat that fat geezer an' then 'e changes into somefin' even bigger...!?

<se_low>Yangus: I s'pose we'd just 'ave to fight 'im again, eh?
No sense givin' up now we've come this far.
<se_def>Angelo: I'm quite grateful to the Lord of Darkness.
<se_def>Angelo: It's thanks to him that I managed to escape the abbey for so long.
<se_def>Angelo: ...Er, not that I'm suggesting we shouldn't fight him, of course.
<se_high>Jessica: Without those two jewels, I might never have returned to normal. I owe the statue of Alexandra my thanks.
<se_high>Jessica: I'll find the seven orbs. For Alistair and for Alexandra.
<se_high>Jessica: And I swear that I'll make Rhapthorne pay for what he's done!
<se_low>Yangus: Lookin' for Jessica, lookin' for jewels, lookin' for sage orbs...
<se_low>Yangus: We always seem to be bloomin' lookin' for somefin' when we come 'ere.
<se_def>Angelo: If you're feeling stumped about where to find an orb, you should use the echo flute.
<se_def>Angelo: Empyrea said we'd hear an echo if we played it near one of the sages' orbs, so it's worth a try.
<se_high>Jessica: I knew we'd find one here!
<se_high>Jessica: Alistair's spirit turned into an orb! And he's going to help us in our final battle!
<se_low>Yangus: Toot-oot-ot! ♪ Nice! Sounds like there's an orb 'round 'ere then!
<se_def>Angelo: If we don't find it now, we'll kick ourselves. Come on, it can't be far away!
<se_high>Red: I ain't even gettin' a whiff o' treasure round 'ere. Come on, this is a waste o' time.
<se_low>Morrie: MAGNIFICO! Such a fantastic erection! And this trick of the door. I like to steal this idea for my monstrous pit, ay?
<se_high>Red: Wot are we 'ere for, then, eh? Prayin' to the Goddess? ...Yer a bit of a softie sometimes, ain't ya, <hero>?
<se_high>Red: I don't even know if that statue's legit any'ow. Don't forget 'ow that giant statue o' the Goddess at Neos turned out to be dodgy!
<se_low>Morrie: The high places make my heart sing! And it seems the Lord of the Darkness likes them too, ay?
<se_low>Morrie: Si, maybe our towers are not tall enough to reach our nemesis. But with the power of the Godbird, we have him in our grass, ay?
